page.title: 05Tillingbourne Trout Farm p1
page.content:
The trout farm in Chilworth is a thriving business with three full time workers.
The day at the trout farm begins with "letting the tanks down". This process reduces the amount of water in each tank so the fish are more easily caught. The shop is then opened. Customers range from local people buying small quantities to hotels and large caterers.
Once a day the fish are fed with food bought from the mill next door. The food is in pellet form and contains all the necessary nutrients needed by the fish, especially protein. The fully-grown fish are soaked in brine overnight and then put in the electric smoker.
